intro: Acmella ciliata, commonly known as the spiny cress, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many edible and ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or yellow flowers and its hairy, spiny stems and leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Acmella ciliata is primarily valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in ecological habitats.
